intro: Salicornia borysthenica, commonly known as sea beans or glasswort, is a halophytic plant adapted to grow in saline environments. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms. Its leaves are often fleshy and can store water, while its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. Salicornia borysthenica is also used in some regions for culinary and medicinal purposes.
